info.name: Solitary nucleus
info.description: The solitary nucleus is a visceral sensory nucleus in the medulla & caudal pons located as a thin column of cells just lateral to the sulcus limitans in the floor of the fourth ventricle and surrounding the solitary tract. The rostral portion of the nucleus is AKA the gustatory nucleus since it receives primary afferent taste input via the facial, glossopharyngeal and possibly the vagal nerves; this part of the nucleus is considered special visceral afferent (SVA). The caudal portion of the nucleus receives primary general visceral afferent (GVA) input from the viscera, aortic and carotid barareceptors, etc over the glossopharyngeal and vagal nerves.
